item.title: NSF GRFP Virtual Bootcamp begins April 7th
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 (all day) - Complete online modules at your own pace. Develop strong application materials for this 3 year fellowship which provides salary and tuition for graduate school. Fall 2025 seniors, 1st and 2nd year grad students in STEM fields that do not already hold a graduate degree are eligible. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency required. For info:madige@rpi.edu Feedback on application materials available for all applicants. …

item.title: STEAMM Inventor’s Studio offered in Summer 2025
item.description: Calling all community rising 10th to 12th graders, don’t miss the STEAMM Inventor’s Studio at RPI — a hands-on summer program exploring cutting-edge fields like semiconductors, advanced manufacturing, robotics, AI, quantum computing, and more. This two-week program runs from July 28 to August 8, 2025. Find more details on summer.rpi.edu and apply today.

item.title: RPI Orchestra and ESYO, Side by Side: 2025 Spring Concert to be Held April 5
item.description: Celebrate the collaboration between the Rensselaer Orchestra and the Empire State Youth Orchestra as they perform side-by-side April 5th at 2pm in EMPAC Concert Hall. This spring program includes the breathtaking ‘Elysium’ by Samy Moussa, the famous ‘Symphonie Fantastique’ by Hector Berlioz, and the evocative Oboe Concerto by Thomas L. Read, featuring 2024 Rensselaer Concerto Competition winner Gianna Scire, ’25 as soloist.

item.title: Volunteer for Commencement 2025
item.description: We’re looking for volunteers who will help make Commencement memorable for our graduates and their families. This year’s Commencement ceremony will be held on Saturday, May 10, at 8:30 a.m. in the East Campus Athletic Village stadium. To volunteer, please fill out the volunteer form no later than Friday, April 18. Thank you for your consideration, and we hope you can join us to celebrate the Class of 2025!

item.title: Doane Stuart Tuition Discount
item.description: RPI faculty and staff, families of educators, medical professionals, first responders, veterans, and non-profit employees enjoy a 10% tuition discount at the Doane Stuart School, a private college preparatory school in Rensselaer, New York. To learn more about what Doane Stuart has to offer, view the Doane Stuart Website or contact Doane Stuart Admissions at admissions@doanestuart.org.

item.title: Did You Know RPI Has 209 Clubs and Intramural Sports?
item.description: Many students participate in multiple activities, totaling 8,735 participations per academic year! And here’s another fun fact: the median earnings of RPI undergraduates 10 years after graduation (as of 2021) is $102K. There’s so much more to explore! Dive into Standard 4 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation a team led by Mr. Louis Trzepacz and Ms. Karen Long.
item.author: Community

item.title: Curious About the Middle States Accreditation Findings? | April 9
item.description: At the end of the Middle States Accreditation on-campus visit, the visiting team will host a Community Meeting to present their final report. After reviewing our Self-Study, analyzing hundreds of supporting documents, and engaging with many members of the RPI community during their 2.5-day visit, what will they conclude about RPI? Join us for the Final Readout on Wednesday, April 9, at 11:00 AM. Fun fact: the visiting team will present their report but won’t take questions!
item.author: Community

item.title: ISATMA 2025 Workshop: Neurodivergent Knowing and Creating | April 9
item.description: Wednesday, April 9, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM The International Symposium on Assistive Technology for Music and Art started as a forum for researchers and artists dealing with the physical limitations of the human body and with embodiment in general. Join us for a panel focused on neurodivergent media, thinking, scholarship, pedagogy, and crip curation. Discussion includes opening and closing 30-minute periods to gather and rest in a 360-degree space of ambient sound and moving image.

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Jaemin Cho - Modular and Interpretable Multimodal AI for Improved Generation and Evaluation | April 7
item.description: Monday, April 7, 2025 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM - : Jaemin Cho is a PhD candidate at the Department of Computer Science at UNC-Chapel Hill. His work has been featured at top conferences in computer vision, natural language processing, and machine learning. His work has been recognized through multiple oral presentations at NeurIPS and ICLR, the Bloomberg Data Science PhD Fellowship, and coverage (MIT Technology Review, IEEE Spectrum, and WIRED).
